ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a néŋe Shwóŋè yé gie á líe mengwòŋ, á ncwò Yelemî, ntsẅìnkʉ̀ we.
en: This is the word of the Lord that came to the prophet Jeremiah about the nations:

ngiemboon: Nkʉ̀ gẅie é líe ngwòŋ Egíbtò, mbɔɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pe Falahoŋ Neko gẅie aa fùɔ ngwòŋ Egíbtò. Á laa na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ lekùɔ páʼ Jÿohakim gẅie aa míŋ Jÿosiyásè la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ, afùɔ ngwòŋ Egíbtò gwɔ́ Kakemíshÿè, á ngʉ̀ŋe mí Efelad. Afùɔ Nambukondonozɔɔ gẅie aa fùɔ Mbambilonia lÿɔ́ʼɔ yé né ncù fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, ńjÿó.
en: About Egypt and the army of Pharaoh Neco, Egypt’s king,   which was defeated at Carchemish  # 46:2 2Ch 35:20 on the Euphrates River by King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon in the fourth year of Judah’s King Jehoiakim son of Josiah:  # 46:2 Jr 45:1

ngiemboon: Metándá ncù gɔɔn ngie:
en: Deploy small shields   and large;

ngiemboon: Pi cʉŋ melÿóon, pashwoŋo kwɔ́ʼɔ ndumó!
en: Harness the horses;

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Why have I seen this?

ngiemboon: Tà pakÿo ndʉ̌ tɛʼ té gíŋ ńkuʼu lékÿo wɔ́.
en: The swift cannot flee,

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ sẅé ntse Nílè gẅie é kwɔ́ʼɔ,
en: Who is this, rising like the Nile,

ngiemboon: Ée ngwòŋ Egíbtò gẅie é kwɔ́ʼɔ páʼ Nílè,
en: Egypt rises like the Nile,

ngiemboon: Pi pakwɔ́ʼ melÿóon, pi kem ncù!
en: Rise up, you cavalry!

ngiemboon: Táʼ, yɛ̌ lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, aa ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ,
en: That day belongs to the Lord, the  God of Armies,

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ngɔ́ʼ Egíbtò,
en: Go up to Gilead and get balm,

ngiemboon: Mengwòŋ ne ńjúʼu
en: The nations have heard of your dishonor,

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tsẅii mbwó Yelemî, ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé fʉ̀ʼ gie Nambukondonozɔɔ fùɔ Mbambilonia la tó lélÿɔ́ʼ ngwòŋ Egíbtò:
en: This is the word the Lord spoke to the prophet Jeremiah about the coming of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon to defeat the land of Egypt:

ngiemboon: «Pi gÿo mé fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńjúʼ,
en: Announce it in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol!

ngiemboon: Mélàʼakɔ́ Apísè kÿǒ?
en: Why have your strong ones been swept away?

ngiemboon: Á yé gẅie à gÿo epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kwɔɔnte
en: He continues to stumble.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa na Falahoŋ fùɔ Egíbtò,
en: There they will cry out,

ngiemboon: Afùɔ gẅie lezíŋ sé ée lê
en: As I live —

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a láʼa Egíbtò,
en: Get your bags ready for exile,

ngiemboon: Egíbtò laa zyága múɔ fòŋ gẅie à sí tɛʼ,
en: Egypt is a beautiful young cow,

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù Egíbtò pie é lɔ̌ɔn fóo túmo ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, mé péen wɔ́b,
en: Even her mercenaries among her

ngiemboon: Megàŋmbù ne ńtóo tà ńgwɔ́ nùɔ,
en: Egypt will hiss like a slithering snake,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkɔ́ʼɔ mbím ye,
en: They will cut down her forest —

ngiemboon: Ée shʉ́ mbwó Egíbtò:
en: Daughter Egypt will be put to shame,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńgwɔ́ Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ gɔ̌ɔn ngie: «N ge jÿɔ́gɔ kɔʼɔ́ Amɔŋ we No, é gie ee ssé tÿǒsoŋo Tembɛ́sè, mbɔɔ ye Egíbtò, lé messé mé, ńgÿo mefùɔ pé, é jÿɔ́gɔ kɔ̌ʼ ye Falahoŋ, mbɔɔ ye pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m na yé.
en: The Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says, “I am about to punish Amon, god of Thebes,   along with Pharaoh, Egypt, her gods, and her kings #— #Pharaoh and those trusting in him.

ngiemboon: N ge sẅéen wɔ́b néŋe na mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne ńkwoŋo lézẅéte wɔ́b: Á mbwó Nambukondonozɔɔ fùɔ Mbambilonia pâ nùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pé.
en: I will hand them over to those who intend to take their lives    #— #to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and his officers. But after this,  # 46:26 Ezk 29:8–14 Egypt  # 46:26 Lit it will be inhabited again as in ancient times.”

ngiemboon: Gù, Ésàlayɛ gẅie ɔɔ ngàŋafàʼ wɔɔn,
en: But you, my servant Jacob, do not be afraid,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And you, my servant Jacob, do not be afraid —
